1.text: Set the apple on a cutting board with the stem side up.

2.text: Poke the tip of a paring knife into the top of the apple.

3.text: Push the blade all the way through the apple.

4.text: Cut all the way around the core to separate it from the apple.

5.text: Remove the knife and push out the core with your thumbs.

6.text: Cut around the inside of the apple if you notice any seeds remaining.

7.text: Place the apple on a flat surface with the stem face up.

8.text: Place the apple corer on the center of the apple.

9.text: Twist the corer as you push it toward the bottom of the apple.

10.text: Pull the corer out to remove the center membrane and seeds.

11.text: Set the apple on a stable cutting surface.

12.text: Cut the apple in half to expose the core.

13.text: Scoop out the core using a spoon or melon baller.

14.text: Slice away the stem and bud on each half with a paring knife.

16.text: Set the apple down on a flat surface with the stem side up.

17.text: Slice across the apple to separate part of it from the stem.

18.text: Turn the apple and cut away the other sides to remove the core.
